FAS ... French Air Service IAS ... Italian Air Service RAF ... Royal Air Force RFC ... Royal Flying Corps RNAS ... Royal Naval Air Service USAS ... United States Air Service * ... Observer ** ... Two-seater Pilot *** ... Gunner P ... probable U ... unconfirmed 1) ... Lt Byrne V. Baucom is sometimes credited with seven victories but the official totalappears to be three. Source: Franks, N.L.R. - Bailey, F.W.: Over the Front (A Complete Record of the Fighter Aces and Units of the United States and French Air Services, 1914-1918), Grub Street, London 1992. 2) ... James Norman Hall is sometimes credited with five victories. Source: Franks, N.L.R. - Bailey, F.W.: c.d. 3) ... John W.F.M. Huffer is usually shown with seven victories (four confirmed, three unconfirmed), only three can be be found in French record. Source: Franks, N.L.R. - Bailey, F.W.: c.d. 4) ... Ewart S. Miller is reputed to have score five victories, but none can be found in surviving records. His victories were listed as three aircraft and two balloons Source: Franks, N.L.R. - Bailey, F.W.: c.d. 5) ... Norman Prince is shown often with having scored five victories, only four seem to have been confirmed. Source: Franks, N.L.R. - Bailey, F.W.: c.d. 6) ... Charles Herbert Veil is recorded with five victories. These cannot be substantiated. Source: Franks, N.L.R. - Bailey, F.W.: c.d. 7) ... Rodney D. Williams scored four victories with the 17th Aero, the 'fifth' victory being recorded as 22 September 1918, but this is assumed to be confused with his fout victory. Source: Franks, N.L.R. - Bailey, F.W.: c.d. 8) ... Ten victories as observer.
